TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a claim with ORG ( “ the Kominternivskyy Court ” ) against her brother . She sought the annulment of her father ’s will .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG left the claim without examination because the parties had failed to attend .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged the same claim with ORG . On DATE the court allowed the applicant ’s request for securing the claim and seized the respondent ’s property .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s claims as unsubstantiated .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed against the judgment . On DATE the ORG left the appeal without examination as lodged out of time .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG allowed the applicant ’s appeal in cassation , which she had to resubmit on CARDINAL occasion in order to comply with procedural requirements , quashed the decision of CARDINAL DATE and sent the case for examination to ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of Appeal examined the applicant ’s appeal on the merits , after she had rectified certain shortcomings in her appeal . The court of appeal quashed the judgment of DATE , finding that the case had not been duly examined by the first - instance court and remitted the case for fresh examination .
CARDINAL . NORP The case is currently pending before the first - instance court .

CARDINAL . In the course of the proceedings before the first - instance court , on DATE and DATE the applicant supplemented her claims . There were CARDINAL expert examinations ordered on the applicant ’s request and the proceedings were accordingly suspended for a total period of DATE . The hearings were adjourned CARDINAL times because of the applicant ’s failure to appear or on her requests . On CARDINAL occasions the hearings were adjourned because of the other participants’ failure to appear and of the judge ’s absence or for technical reasons .
